description:
In a Holy Grail War, Mages (Masters) and their Heroic Spirits (Servants) fight for the control of the Holy Grail—an omnipotent wish-granting device said to fulfill any desire. Years have passed since the end of the Fifth Holy Grail War in Japan. Now, signs portend the emergence of a new Holy Grail in the western American city of Snowfield. Sure enough, Masters and Servants begin to gather...

A missing Servant class...
Impossible Servant summonings...
A nation shrouded in secrecy...
And a city created as a battleground.

In the face of such irregularities, the Holy Grail War is twisted and driven into the depth of madness. Let the curtain rise on a masquerade of humans and heroes, made to dance upon the stage of a false Holy Grail. This is a Holy Grail War covered in lies.

(Source: Official Site, Aniplex USA, edited)

Notes:
• Special premiere of Episode 1 in its English Dub occurred in Los Angeles at the Fate 20th Anniversary Showcase event and as well through Crunchyroll’s YouTube Channel on November 23, 2024 before the Japanese television premiere.
• The Japanese advanced premiere occurred during the "Fate New Year's Eve TV Special 2024" on December 31, 2024.

tags.name: Magic
tags.description: Prominently features magical elements or the use of magic.

tags.name: Urban Fantasy
tags.description: Set in a world similar to the real world, but with the existence of magic or other supernatural elements.

tags.name: Urban
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a city.

tags.name: Foreign
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a country outside the country of origin.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Police
tags.description: Centers around the life and activities of law enforcement officers.

tags.name: Swordplay
tags.description: Prominently features the use of swords in combat.

tags.name: Religion
tags.description: Centers on the belief that humanity is related to supernatural, transcendental, and spiritual elements.

tags.name: Cyborg
tags.description: Prominently features a human character whose physiological functions are aided or enhanced by artificial means.

tags.name: Assassins
tags.description: Centers around characters who murder people as a profession.

tags.name: Archery
tags.description: Centers around the sport of archery, or prominently features the use of archery in combat.

tags.name: Vampire
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a vampire.

tags.name: Conspiracy
tags.description: Contains one or more factions controlling or attempting to control the world from the shadows.

tags.name: Dissociative Identities
tags.description: A case where one or more people share the same body.

tags.name: War
tags.description: Partly or completely set during wartime.

tags.name: Mythology
tags.description: Prominently features mythological elements, especially those from religious or cultural tradition.

tags.name: Guns
tags.description: Prominently features the use of guns in combat.

tags.name: Battle Royale
tags.description: Centers around a fierce group competition, often violent and with only one winner.

tags.name: Death Game
tags.description: Features characters participating in a game, where failure results in death.

tags.name: Nun
tags.description: Prominently features a character who is a nun.

node.description:
__[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ryohgo_narita)__

_Ryougo Narita_ is a Japanese light novelist and manga writer. He won the Gold Prize in the 9th Dengeki Novel Prize for Baccano!, which was made into an anime television series in 2007. His series Durarara!! was also made into two anime television series, one airing in January 2010 and the second in January 2015.

(Source: Wikipedia)

__Headquarters:__ Tokyo, Japan

__[Website](http://typemoon.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/tmitterofficial)__

__Introduction:__
Type-Moon is a Japanese game company was founded by artist [Takashi Takeuchi](https://anilist.co/staff/99054/Takashi-Takeuchi) and writer [Kinoko Nasu](https://anilist.co/staff/98250/Kinoko-Nasu), who were also schoolmates. The names "TYPE-MOON" and "Notes." come from one of their early works, Notes..

__History:__
Originally formed as a Doujin Soft in 2000 and created the popular visual novel Tsukihime, but turned into a Commercial Organization on January 30, 2004 and in the same year, they released their PC-based eroge visual novel game Fate/stay night, which is their most well known title.

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/mayuge1017)

A Tokyo Zoukei University graduate, he's one of the leading digital animators in the industry, with good character animation and catchy effects.

He is a "follower" of [Tatsuya Yoshihara](https://anilist.co/staff/112047/). In his university days, he was in the same circle as [Ryuu Nakayama](https://anilist.co/staff/133512/). They still have a good relationship and work with each other a lot. 

He is also a good friend of [Takahito Sakazume](https://anilist.co/staff/131945/), the two working often as a "two man production team."

Enokido is mainly known for his work on the Fate franchise, being both the action director for [Fate/Apocrypha](https://anilist.co/anime/98035/) and having directed the majority of the [Fate/Grand Order Commercials](https://anilist.co/anime/101184/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/yamada_uk) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/22HS_drill/) Originating from [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/). Works outside anime: - Melty Blood: Type Lumina (Video Game, 2021) (Cut-in Animation Character Design, Animation Director, Key Animation)

[Website](http://www.sawanohiroyuki.com/) | [Website (nZk)](http://www.sh-nzk.net) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sawano_nZk) | [Instagram (Official)](https://www.instagram.com/hiroyukisawano.official/) | [Instagram (Personal)](https://www.instagram.com/sawano__hiroyuki/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/user/SawanoHiroyukiSMEJ) | [Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/0Riv2KnFcLZA3JSVryRg4y?si=KaE_XDXqSRewfXXsxBNzoA) | [Apple Music](https://music.apple.com/artist/hiroyuki-sawano/156620523) | [Deezer](https://www.deezer.com/artist/1315147) 

Composer and musician represented by VV-ALKLINE since 2017. He was previously with Legendoor from 2006 to 2017. 
Sawano began practicing the piano at an early age, and studied composition, arrangement, orchestration, and piano under Nobuchika Tsuboi from the age of 17.

Active as a composer since 2004, he first gained recognition for his work on the Team Medical Dragon TV drama in 2006. He made his debut as an anime composer in 2006 on [Soul Link](https://anilist.co/anime/854/). In 2009, he released his first solo album *musica*, which included some of his more popular songs done for TV shows. In 2014, he launched a new vocal song project under the name "SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]", producing the first album *UnChild* with [Aimer](https://anilist.co/staff/107859/) as the vocalist under the name SawanoHiroyuki[nZk]:Aimer. Since then his songs under this vocal song project have also been used as the opening and ending themes for various anime.

He has cited [Joe Hisaishi](https://anilist.co/staff/100738/), [Youko Kanno](https://anilist.co/staff/95508/), [Hans Zimmer](https://anilist.co/staff/104669/) and Danny Elfman as major inspirations.

Non-anime role:

• **Xenoblade Chronicles X (music)** 
• **Xenoblade Chronicles X Definitive Edition (music)**

Freelancer. Recognizable for his bassy and often reverbed sound effects.

Regularly works with [Yoshikazu Iwanami](https://anilist.co/staff/101016/) and [Jin Aketagawa](https://anilist.co/staff/103074/).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/tk_mogi)

Color designer who works frequently with [A-1 Pictures](https://anilist.co/studio/561/A1-Pictures).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hakuoishii)

Trilingual, speaking fluent Taiwanese, Japanese and English. He graduated from Tokyo Designer College.

Initially gained recognition by directing [My Hero Academia](https://anilist.co/anime/21459/My-Hero-Academia/)'s First Season action finale, where he displayed many of the characteristics he would refine later. A certain penchant for action storyboarding and climax episodes involving his acquaintances among some of the most talented digital animators in the industry.

This style was consolidated on [Fate/Apocrypha](https://anilist.co/anime/98035/FateApocrypha/)  Ep. 22 and later on [Mob Psycho II](https://anilist.co/anime/101338/Mob-Psycho-100-II/) Ep. 5.
Formerly affiliated with [AIC](https://anilist.co/studio/48/AIC), currently working at [Senju Kobo](https://anilist.co/studio/7581/Senju-Kobo).
